metadata.title: CVE-2019-11745 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When encrypting with a block cipher, if a call to NSC_EncryptUpdate wasmade with data smaller than the block size, a small out of bounds writecould occur. This could have caused heap corruption and a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, FirefoxESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

criterions.comment: nss: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
